definition: to pass over/to skip
plan/strategy/outline/summary/slightly/rather/to rob/to plunder/to summarize/to omit
(experienced action marker)
surname Guo
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: Unemployment is one of the major problem of modern times.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們略過這些枝節來談主要問題吧。

sentences.english: I pass over many other things peculiar to this island, lest I should weary you.
sentences.chinese: 我略過這個島上很多奇怪的事情，免得我讓你厭煩。

sentences.english: When your boss skips a few rules, he'sbeing original.
sentences.chinese: 老闆略過一些禮節，他獨具一格。

sentences.english: You think I can just skip it now and get to it at college?
sentences.chinese: 你想我現在略過數學，等到上了大學再學可以嗎？

sentences.english: Suitable for beginners, prawns can skip, welcome criticism and.
sentences.chinese: 適合入門者，大蝦可略過，歡迎批評指正。

sentences.english: The one that I've already suggested you skip.
sentences.chinese: 就是哪些我之前建議你可以略過的那些部份。

sentences.english: Once again, we skip time to the house I am currently living in now.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們再次略過時間，把故事帶到我們現在住的房子。

sentences.english: Let's skip over these details and come to the main point.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們略過這些枝節來談主要問題吧。

sentences.english: And when it comes to providing emotional support, he says, skip the platitudes.
sentences.chinese: 當說到提供情感支持時，他說，略過那些個陳詞濫調。

sentences.english: Skip to the next article. You certainly could—you could skip the whole magazine.
sentences.chinese: 雖然你可以略過整篇雜誌。

sentences.english: Skip the corn oil and pure vegetable oil.
sentences.chinese: 略過玉米油和純植物油。

sentences.english: Don’t skip workouts. You should aim to exercise every day.
sentences.chinese: 不能略過了練習，你應該力爭每天都要鍛鍊。

definition: reluctant to part
to digress/to stray from the subject
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
light bulb/(slang) unwanted third guest
lit. the dragonfly touches the water lightly/superficial contact (idiom)
the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
to provoke/to tease
to take a lot of trouble (over sb or sth)/may I trouble you (to do sth)
to show respect from a distance (idiom)/to remain at a respectful distance
to be a real headache/to find sth a real headache/to beat one's brains
lit. if it's wrong, it's wrong (idiom); to make the best after a mistake/to accept an error and adapt to it/to muddle through
(idiom) (of a good outcome) unanticipated/serendipitous/fortuitous
layman
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
to murmur endearments (idiom)/to get into a romantic relationship
to contempt/to disdain/pejorative
